etymologies: late 18th century: modern Latin, from Greek platupous ‘flat-footed’, from platus ‘flat’ + pous ‘foot’

definitions: a semiaquatic egg-laying mammal which frequents lakes and streams in eastern Australia. It has a sensitive pliable bill shaped like that of a duck, webbed feet with venomous spurs, and dense fur.

notes.text: Ornithorhynchus anatinus, the only member of the family Ornithorhynchidae, order Monotremata

shortDefinitions: semiaquatic egg-laying mammal which frequents lakes and streams in eastern Australia
